scraper.py¶

Contains functions for grabbing data from the Internet.

TUNL: - we download the necessary pdf from TUNL - then look through the PDF and pick out important values using tabula

But TUNL wasn’t a great source since their data isn’t very parse-able

Instead, use Brookhaven’s site: nndc.bnl.gov

ncsd_python.plot_modules.scraper.get_bnl_data(calc_data)¶

Function to get data from BNL

ncsd_python.plot_modules.scraper.get_online_data_wrapper(calc_data, get_online_data)¶

This tries to get online data, but doesn’t break everything if it fails. Instead, filler data is returned.

ncsd_python.plot_modules.scraper.get_tunl_data(calc_data)¶

Function to get data from TUNL. Currently only gets energies, but if you have any ideas about how to get J, T, parity let me know!

ncsd_python.plot_modules.scraper.parse_tunl_pdf(pdf_url, pdf_save_path)¶

returns Ex column of pdf from TUNL, without uncertainties
